reviewText: LONG BEFORE THE "NEWER" ENTERTAINERS WERE BORN, MUSICIANS, SINGERS AND DANCERS HAD SOMETHING CALLED "TALENT".  BACK THEN, THERE WAS NO NEED FOR FLASY VISUALS OR VULGAR LANGUAGE TO TAKE YOUR MIND OFF THAT WHAT YOU WERE SEEING WAS NOT ENTERTAINING...GENUINE TALENT WAS ENOUGH.  THIS DVD WAS ENJOYABLE, FROM BEGINNING TO END.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Sunday nights meant Lawrence Welk. This gathering of musical pieces brought back so many memories! We leave it playing in the background now when we have a Sunday supper gathering. It just makes everyone smile.
summary: And a one and a two...
Title: N/A

reviewText: In 2001 many of the Welk stars reunited at the CHampagne Theatre in Branson, MO.  This vhs/dvd captures that magical evening.  A highlight was Bobbie Burgess dancing with all THREE of his dancing partners.  Unfortunately quite a few of the stars are no longer shining--they have passed on.  But this tape is a wonderful rememberance of what made Mr Welk a must see for so many years.  The recording is rather long--and is seperated into many acts.  The good clean fun Mr Welk is remembered for is here for all to enjoy.  Normer Zimmer, Mary Lou, Tom Netherton, Guy and Ralna all stop by to share memories.  THIS IS THE ONLY RECORDING OF ALMOST ALL THE WELK STARS REUNITING ON ONE STAGE.  A MUST HAVE, A MUST SEE. It's uplifting and if you are a Welk fan--it can be a tearjerker too.  The kind of entertainment presented here is long gone in America--and has been replaced with reality tv shows-rape-murder-and mayhem.  WUNNERFUL WUNNERFUL I rate this dvd/vhs.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was the reunion of the Welk family of entertainers. Wonderful seeing all of them again and they had not lost a step. The love they had for each other and their audience was palpable. Great.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a reunion of the old stars of the show, after Welk passed away.  Therefore, it does not have the charm of the TV show.
summary: This does NOT have Lawrence Welk as host!
